recipesJson.name: U-Haul roadie ( Sour patch watermelon slurpee MTL)
recipesJson.author: MECH_MOD_RN
recipesJson.description:
made for Fresh03 show   SaturDIY'ing with fresh03 and Friends! Moving Sucks!
   https://youtu.be/H3AqSJwIZW8

This is my take on a   7  - 11  sour patch watermelon Slurpee, that you would pick up for that  long  ride
 it is nice bright sweet candy  watermelon on the inhale and a   sweet tart watermelon on the back. 
Tested  in the BSRK v1.5  at 25 - 35 watts on a .30 braided coil     -  this also woks in an RDA very well  and it is full flavored  in your  face sourpatch watermelon slurpee with some  light lemon/lime  notes that are additionally picked up  

**WF sour watermelon** is  a great candy flavor and perfect for this mix , it is a big old sweet  candy watermelon with a light  tart note similar to a jolly rancher
**The big watermelon**  helps add some of that juicy body that a slurpee needs  and works well here
**Lemon lime soda** is needed for some contrast to  all that sweetness of the watermelon   and really helps  add some  wetness and vibrancy to the watermelon   
**Sour gummy candy** adds some  volume and body to this mix along with more of a nice tart note on the back   
**Polar Blast**  is optional  but for a slushie  really works  and for my liking I would take it up to 1.5   in a pod set up   
Add sweetner to taste, but this is really sweet on its on,  with the cotton candy .  But slurpees are SWEET so I added .3% of cap super sweet

reviews.text: I don't know why you don't get more rave reviews for your inventive recipes. Your lemonade bases are the best I've come across yet. Love the way you use WF Lemon lime Soda to add wetness and vibrancy to lemonades. Thanks a mill for sharing.
